title: Steeley
author: Steeley
content: Not all those initial Ebay prices are what the buyer receives. Picture speaks for itself. One of you lucky dogs probably owns this now Â 1. Great collections sold 4 Bitbills June 25 2023 Â Â Â Â Â  - Loaded 1BTC Bitbill - sold $27,500 (30,937 with fee) - Loaded Value at time $30,195Â Â Â Â Â  - Loaded 5BTC Bitbill - sold 137,500 (154,687 with fee) Loaded value when sold 150,975Â Â Â Â Â  - Loaded 10BTC Bitbill - sold 270,000 (303,750 with fee) Loaded value when sold 301,950Â Â Â Â Â  - Loaded 20BTC Bitbill - sold 505,000 (568,125 with fee) Loaded value when sold 603,900Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â 2. Nasty Fans 1 Seat Gilt Â Â Â Â Â  Â  Â  Two notes, First, One sold on Great Collections for $69 Â Â Â Â Â  Â  Â  Second, No attribution given to Nasty Fans either on Great Collections or by ICG who graded it as MS70. Thought this was strange.Â Â Â 3 Silver Gilt 10 BTC Casacious - 2 sales this yearÂ Â Â Â Â Â Great Collections - june 2023 - sold 263,000 (295,875 with fee) - Loaded Value at time 301,950Â Â Â Stacks Bowers - August 2023 - sold 312,000 - loaded value at time 260,0004. Cool swap. Someone (probably one of you) bought a Lealana 1 LTC loaded on Stacks Bowers for $288 and sold it 2 months later on Ebay $500. Arbitrage in action. More interesting sales news to come...

comments.author: rsincognito
comments.body: Damn I donâ€™t know how I missed the Hold B Lealana on eBay ðŸ™„. That was free money .

comments.author: krogothmanhattan
comments.body: Yep those auctions prices went for a steal......I wouldnt risk any of my precious collectables without a reserve price...no fucken way!

comments.author: bitbollo
comments.body: wow these are interesting purchases.  this generally happens in collecting when they are niche items. there are buyers who do not monitor the market on a daily basis. there are other buyers who do not buy at market prices.For example, I was risking selling a collector's tax stamp from the 1800s at auction for 10 euros (symbolic figure) when usually the fixed price would be between 300/500 euros... or a collection of proofs/essays from 3000/5000 euros to less than 100 euros... (both cases in ebay)solution? better  starting prices and of course if don't sell just wait for the right moment.related arbitrage for collectors or sellers is pretty common practice not surprised too much... well there are not already available large lots to be checked, but I guess in 100 or more years, this practice will become pretty usual.

comments.author: crwth
comments.body: Thank you for sharing this. There's really something to get if you manage to see the value of something before it even reaches the point where it is really valuable like what we are saying now like "Wow, this is a steal" and many more. It's definitely something that could be worth studying and maybe verifying to see any "steal collectibles" now and invest in the future in just 5 - 10 years.That's definitely intense.
